text: My name is Dr. Kartikeya Tripathi.
Dr. K. in short.
I got my PhD in electrical engineering from
the University of Florida in 2006.
It had been a dream of mine to try go to MIT.
That didn't happen, but then
along came OpenCourseWare.
And I thought I'd take a look at some of the
courses that were available.
And in particular, I wanted to learn a lot
about linear algebra.
And by a stroke of good luck,
I was able to find Dr. Gilbert Strang's videos
on linear algebra.
I forced myself to take those classes
as if I was a student in his class physically
present there. I did all the homeworks.
I did attended all the lectures.
I took all the exams
and I can easily say without hyperbole that
it changed my life.
I learned a tremendous amount of wonderful
information from his extraordinary pedagogical style.
And that has really paved the way for me
to learn much more incredible and beautiful things
in higher mathematics, and in probability
and statistical theory.
Professor Strang, if you ever get a chance
to see this, sir, I will forever
be indebted to you. You don't know how much
you've changed the life of people
that you will never probably get the chance to meet.
So to Professor Strang, I'm grateful.
To MIT, I am grateful.
Thank you very much for the extraordinary
work you do. Thank you very much.
